TopicTitle: Do you use your laptop or your desktop computer to play games?

Articles.Content:
(Please replace Computer with Desktop.)

I use my desktop. My laptop is used to kill time, and it can only run low-end stuff.

I despise common laptops because they come with too much bloatware and made people think that you could really run games on a laptop in 2012. No, you still can't run BF3 on super high quality on your new laptop.

[/rant]

So on what do you play KSP on? Your laptop or your desktop computer?

Wrong... you totally can, and I am playing that right now.

My laptop is fast... It isn't true that you can't get a laptop that you can run BF3 at OGM SUPER REALISTIK IND CERL. You can, and I have one.

(A lot has changed, I got a monitor, keyboard, and a new mouse. But it is all running of the laptop.

I have both laptop and desktop, and use both interchangably. While the desktop is more powerful, the laptop is close enough that in most cases, the difference isn't noticeable, and the laptop has a higher-quality screen, so even with marginally less clutter or shadow resolution, the game still tends to look better. It's not all in the settings - sometimes, it just needs better colours to be a better experience.

Play all my games on my PC. (See sig for specs)

I plan on new joystick soon (Mine squeeks when used) + Dell 3011 upgrade.

Desktop only. Something about not having had a laptop since spring 2003...
Given that the closest thing to a Laptop I own is a tiny little Netbook, I play games on my Desktop PC.

I play rigs of rods with barely any lag on my laptop. Of course, I have to use OpenGL due to game crashes with directX.

This is a AMD proccescor with 2 GB DDR3, unlike my old computer with 2 GBs of ddr2. I play minecraft and other java games on my desktop.

I have a serious computer. I use pre/superftch to take the slump out of hardened paging sectors. and still have issues. It takes about 5 10 sec to get the green for blastoff, or as i have come to know it "the green for kerbal death" . but the load time is unavoidable, it is not a Dev thing or an Optimization thing, when you load the game the system is undertaking SERIOUS physics computation and calculation.

That being said we must think of this more as a sim as i'm sure all of you do. Hell i'm eatin toothpaste and sleeping in a bag on my wall since i got this game I also have a 2 core intel Hewlett with good specs. needless to say, my laptop would be preforming EVA out my window if I tried to play ksp on it. I guess if I get a better got one I could play on both, its kinda silly though unless your only option is to play on a laptop I would avoid it. There not designed to do the same stuff as desktops..... Ut res coniecto i think laptops are ok for some games unless u have a really expensive one. soooooo after all that noise.... desktop!!!
